André Panisson

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/6788358844418721
  • Última atualização do currículo em 02/12/2013

André Panisson is a Researcher at the Data Science Laboratory of the Institute for Scientific Interchange in Turin, Italy. He received his PhD in Computer science from the University of Turin (Italy) in February 2012. His PhD thesis, entitled "Selective Information Dissemination for Mobile Computing," was focused on how information can be effectively disseminated within communities of interest in the scope of mobile computing. He received his MSc in Computer Science from the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil) in 2007. His current research focuses on development of tools to facilitate the analysis, modeling, simulation and measurement of complex phenomena in systems that involve technological and social factors, using the concepts of complex networks to investigate activity patterns, communication and emergent properties. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2010 - 2011
SALC Services à la Carte
Descrição: A Finpiemonte-funded project, under Polo ICT framework, focused on configuring and managing user-driven media services. The SALC project aims at developing a technological, extensible platform enabling on demand aggregation of heterogeneous digital media services, composed of a set of basic services like content storage, content delivery, content negotiation, contracting, event reporting and others..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: André Panisson - Integrante / Ruffo, Giancarlo - Coordenador.
2010 - Atual
is4.mobi: Interactive Services for Mobiles
Descrição: A Finpiemonte-funded project for the implementation of a demonstrative platform that can enable the rapid development of accessible and multi-platform services for different mobile devices. The aim is to overcome the technology fragmentation barrier that exists today, in particular for building user interfaces and to access sensors, phone features and data produced by devices, and to provide optimized communication protocols in mobile computing..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: André Panisson - Integrante / Ruffo, Giancarlo - Coordenador.
2009 - 2010
RD-PVR: Recommendation & Discovery for Personal Video Recording
Descrição: The goal of this project is to use events discretization combined with a col- laborative filtering approach to make good predictions of user s registrations, in the Personal Video Recording services domain. The approach is based on the analysis of real data generated by the Faucet PVR system (www.vcast. it/faucetpvr), integrated in a web-based podcasting service named VCast (www.vcast.it). Faucet allows users to record favorite TV and Radio (italian) programs, that can be further downloaded into their devices (e.g., iPod, PC, notebook). This system produces a very rich and dynamic data set, populated by real users expressing their preferences through the recorded programs. If such a collaborative filtering approach is able to make good predictions of the registrations, it could be immediately applied in a Recommender System tool for implementing user personalization..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: André Panisson - Integrante / Giancarlo Ruffo - Coordenador.
2009 - Atual
Patterns of human activity in web-based and pervasive systems
Descrição: In collaboration with the Institute for Scientific Interchange Foundation through Ciro Cattuto since July/2009, the participation in the SocioPatterns project is an opportunity of integration with the Complex Networks community. The SocioPatterns project aims to shed light on patterns in social dynamics and coordinated human activity. It do so by developing and deploying an experimental social interaction sensing platform. This platform consists of portable sensing device and software tools for aggregating, analyzing and visualizing the resulting data. With the project entitled "Patterns of human activity in web-based and pervasive systems", we aim to conduct research under the project on complex networks in which the ISI Foundation is commited. In this research area are included some european and national activities. The research is focused in the study of complex networks dynamic fenomena, in a way to bind the topologic properties of these networks with the dynamic properties. In particular, the research compares statistical phisics and epidemiologic models to study the dynamics and propagation of information in complex networks. As a first step, the data gathered by ISI Foundation from the SocioPatterns experiments was analysed and used to investigate the statistical properties of mobility and human contacts in bounded space. The work concentrates in the simulation of information propagation processes that can occur in the dynamic network of human contacts. The result is the publication of specific papers in pervasive computation and ad-hoc networking fields..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: André Panisson - Coordenador.


Projetos de extensão

PET - Programa Especial de Treinamento
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Extensão.

Integrantes: André Panisson - Coordenador.


Projetos de desenvolvimento
2010 - 2010
Gephi Graph Streaming API
Descrição: In April 2010, a project proposal with the Gephi development team has been accepted for the Google Summer of Code program. The program is the best way for students around the world to start contributing to an open-source project. Gephi's project aims to bring the perfect tool for visualizing and manipulating networks, focusing on usability, performance and modularity. The project timeline started at May 24 2010 and ended at August 16 2010. The purpose of the Graph Streaming API project is to build a unified framework for streaming graph objects. Gephi's data structure and visualization engine has been built with the idea that a graph is not static and might change continuously. By connecting Gephi with external data-sources, we leverage its power to visualize and monitor complex systems or enterprise data in real-time. Moreover, the idea of streaming graph data goes beyond Gephi, and a unified and standardized API could bring interoperability with other available tools for graph and network analysis, as they could start to interoperate with other tools in a distributed and cooperative fashion. Some project's results can be viewed at http://gephi.org/2010/gsoc-2010-mid-term-graph-streaming-api/. The support and activity continues after the end of the Google Summer of Code timeline, as a research activity in collaboration also with ISI Foundation in the scope of the SocioPatterns project..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Desenvolvimento.

Integrantes: André Panisson - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Google Inc. - Auxílio financeiro.
1999 - 2002
Núcleo de Aprendizagem Virtual - NAVi
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Desenvolvimento.

Integrantes: André Panisson - Coordenador.
